creator: yudi.s@iname.com
text:
Overview Description
JSP fail written to .java in tomcat's work directory

Step to reproduce.
1. Start tomcat
2. request any JSP pages (even any JSP examples pages)

Actual result
Browser won't display any result (waiting)

in work/[blah]examples the parsed java files growing in size forever

Expected result
JSP pages parsed properly and displayed in browser

Built date & platform
using binary jakarta-tomcat-3.2.1.tar.gz from jakarta.apache.org

HOSTTYPE=i386
OSTYPE=solaris2.5
ARCH=pc.i86.solaris
MACHTYPE=i386-pc-solaris2.

Additional Builds and Platforms: 
occours on above platform using netscape4 (IE n/a)

does not occours on :
using the same binary package does not occour on :
win 2000 professional IE5 /Netscape4
win 98 IE5 /Netscape4

I believe this is a bug in your JVM.  Please try a newer JVM.
Some info from the tomcat-users mailing list follows:

==================
From: Danno Ferrin 
Subject:  Re: jsp -> class infinite loop
Date:  Mon, 17 Jul 2000 09:32:27 -0600

It's a bug in the production release of Solaria Java 1.2.2.  Not sure
what the version that works (I think it was 1.2.1 or some earlier 1.2.2
production release) but you are not the first person to post that error,
and the error was determined to be a bug in the implementation of the
1.2.2 JVM.

--Danno

Larkin Lowrey wrote:
>
> I just installed tomcat and I am having a problem with jsp. When I
> request a jsp file and it must be compiled to .java tomcat goes into an
> infinite loop repeating the last println statement over and over in the
> new .java file.
>
> I'm currently running tomcat 3.2b2 but had the same problem with 3.1.
> Solaris x86 2.7
> Java 1.2.2
>
> Any hints? Tips? Tricks?
>
> Larkin Lowrey
> llowrey@NuclearWinter.com

=======================
From: 
Subject:  Re: jsp -> class infinite loop
Date:  Mon, 17 Jul 2000 17:38:03 +0200 (CEST)

Exactly. 1.2.2_05 is the buggy one, maybe 1.2.2_05a as well (I'm not
sure). 1.3.0 beta works fine for me (Sol 2.8 x86), on Sol 2.7 x86 I
used
to have 1.2.1_03 - without any problems.

regards
Roman Kratochvil
